@graph.skos:definition: The subject is written by the Object.

A direct-hire employee of Morgan Stanley, or an individual contractor/contingent worker. (This includes contractors who are allowed to log into MS systems and operate much as employees. It does not include vendors who are not individually recognized by MS.)

@graph.skos:defination: A transitive property in which the objectexercises ownership rights over the subject, or has some responsibility for the subject, or has some responsibility for the Subject.
Points to a taxonomy item or other less formally defined class.
Points to a status category to capture what state an issue is in at any given time
Relates something, often a process, to the primary accociated risk.
A type of risk typically in a taxonomy for categorizing potential risk events.
The Subject, often a process, has the Object, an identified risk which impacts the process.
An intention that sets out a state of satisfaction (You are required to drive on right side of the road)
The assurance that an issue has been resolved prior to being closed, requires for all high and critical issues. The responsibility is assigned to a Closure Verification Owner.
The Object (e.g. Personnel) has been proposed to be the New owner of the Subject (e.g. ControlInstance).

@graph.skos:definition: A direct-hire employee of Morgan Stanley, or an individual contractor/contingent worker. (This includes contractors who are allowed to log into MS systems and operate much as employees. It does not include vendors who are not individually recognized by MS.)

@graph.skos:defination: The Subject is an issue at a physical geographic location (Object) .

@graph.skos:definition: A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory. A region recognized as an independent political entity.
A bounded region (or set of regions) on the surface of the Earth.

@graph.skos:defination: The subject is remidiated/resolved by the Object.

@graph.skos:definition: A detailed description of steps to be implemented to remidiate, eliminate or lower a risk, or resolve an Issue.

@graph.skos:defination: The Subject, often a process, has the Object, an identified risk which impacts the process.

@graph.skos:definition: A type of risk typically in a taxonomy for categorizing potential risk events.

@graph.skos:defination: Indicates that a subject has a status comment author.

@graph.skos:definition: A direct-hire employee of Morgan Stanley, or an individual contractor/contingent worker. (This includes contractors who are allowed to log into MS systems and operate much as employees. It does not include vendors who are not individually recognized by MS.)

@graph.skos:defination: The Subject has been identified as an Issue that may adversely affect the Object

@graph.skos:definition: [Per PROV-O] A running/executing piece of software, characterized by performing actions and producing effects.
A representation of a collection or processes of subprocesses within the Business Process Taxonomy Structure.
A divisional or departmental organization that is part of Morgan stanley.
A defined, virtual , memberless organization to which direct and indirect costs are allocated.
A type of control, e.g in a taxonomy of control types.
A mitigating action or intitiative that is applied against Firm risk(s) to reduce the impact and/or frequency with which the risk(s) would otherwise manifest themselves.
A synthetic object represnting a particular risk associated with a particular process.

@graph.skos:defination: The Obeject is the primary factor that results in the Subject.

@graph.skos:definition: A classification for why something has happened.

@graph.skos:defination: A determination of some aspect or quality of the Subject and the result is the Object

@graph.skos:definition: A category indicating the likelihood of occurrence or re-occurrence of a risk event. E.g. infrequent, occasional.
A numerical rating ranging from one to eight that corresponds to a given combination of impact and frequency for a particular risk.

@graph.skos:defination: This property indicates that a subject has a Contributor.
The Object is the Organization of the Owner of the Subject.
The Object exists as a consequence of the Subject, but without implying agency on the Subject's part.

@graph.skos:definition: The acceptance of a risk through a documented decision that is approved by an appropriate risk committee for a specified period of time, applying to risks that are assessed as hight or critical under the Frim's Risk Level Standards.

@graph.skos:defination: The Subject exists as a consequence of the Object, but without implying agency on the Object's part.

@graph.skos:definition: An event whereby a determination is made as to the nature and or quality of something.

@graph.skos:defination: Points to a taxonomy item or other less formally defined class.

@graph.skos:definition: The decision of whether to remidiate or accept a risk.

A flag to indicate if the issue contains highly confidential information that should not be made available to general users. Only the Assessment stakeholders (Assessment Coordinator or Assessment Owner) or those named on the issue will be able to see the confidential items.
The nature of the impact, e.g. economic, regulatory.
This is a status to determine, when there is a control deficiency, what kind of deficiency it is.
A status indicates the current state of an Action Plan.

@graph.skos:defination: A determination of some aspect or quality of the Subject and the result is the Object

@graph.skos:definition: A Level of risk established relative to risk tolerance, that applies at the overall firm level.
A category indicating the likelihood of occurrence or re-occurrence of a risk event. E.g. infrequent, occasional.
A measure of the severity of the risk, on an A-H scae from minor to severe.
A numerical rating ranging from one to eight that corresponds to a given combination of impact and frequency for a particular risk.
